title: Head, Financial Operations and Tax Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited
content:
ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services. Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Financial Operations and Tax
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The HOD, Financial Operations & Tax is responsible for developing and monitoring finance policies, processes, and ensure compliance with IFRS, related standards and ensuring seamless implementation of the finance operations flows from fixed assets accounting, payables, inventory, etc.
	He/She will work with the unit head and under the supervision of the Chief Financial Officer, to develop and execute processes and plans that align with the overall strategic objectives of ipNX.
	To ensure efficiency in the finance operations of the company through the provision of effective support services covering the management of financial and administrative systems, to contribute to the delivery of the company’s overall commercial objectives.


Responsibilities


	Prepare and present monthly, quarterly, half yearly and annual reports that are free from errors for management decision making.
	Drive initiatives to support the Divisions and Corporate Centre with financial information to aid decision-making.
	Managing Inventories, Fixed assets (Project to Assets), payables and GL analysis.
	Accurate presentation of annual reports for audit in line IFRS requirements for audit certification
	Managing all Taxes (VAT, WHT,CIT etc), Tax audit and all the related compliances
	Timely closure on projects and accurate recognition
	Drive accounting system automations
	Constantly review processes for standard and compliance
	Drive compliance and accounting treatment in line with the IFRS provisions
	Manage and reconcile all General Ledger/Sub- ledger Accounts filtering into Income statement, Balance Sheet and Cashflow.
	Ensuring all the schedules are inline with the posting


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting / Economics / Banking and Finance or related field from a reputable institution. (2.1/Upper Credit Minimum)
	Minimum of 10 years post-qualification experience.
	Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business is an added advantage.
	Professional qualification such as ICAN, ACA, ACCA.
	Experience In Implementing ERP System is an added advantage.
	Must have had a good experience working within fast growing companies in developing markets – Telecoms sector would be an added advantage.
	Must be technologically savvy with working knowledge of ERP
	Industry experience: Banking, Corporate Financial Services, Investment Management.
	Working knowledge of processes, reporting, management accounting and corporate finance.
	Knowledge of Financial management systems, accounting policies and standards (IFRS, GAAP) and costing accounting etc.
	Strong working knowledge of advance Excel
	Strong work ethics.


 

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Logistics Officer Job at Gas Tech International Limited
content:
Gas Tech International Limited is an emerging Compressed and Natural Gas organisation situated along the Sagamu-Ore expressway in Ilisan, Ikenne local government area, Ogun State. We are looking to enhance our team with additional talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer

Job Location: Ilisan Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Logistics
Reports to: Logistics Manager

Position Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Logistics Officer is responsible for coordinating, monitoring, and reporting on the movement, condition, and documentation of trucks, skids, and CNG delivery activities.
	This role ensures that logistics operations are carried out safely, timely manner, and in compliance with industry and regulatory standards, while supporting the overall efficiency of CNG dispatch to customers.


Tasks and Activities of the Role


	Ability to inspect trucks and skids upon arrival
	Ensure truck and skid cleanliness before dispatch
	Confirm the validity of truck documents, driver’s license, and tire pressure.
	Ability to monitor truck movement using the GPS tracker
	Monitor customer gas flow rate and plan dispatch timing accordingly.
	Ability to report all the logistics activities
	Ensure PPE compliance.


Required Skills and Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Transport Management, or related technical field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in gas plant or logistics operations (CNG preferred)
	Familiarity with GPS tracking and ERP/logistics systems.
	Understanding of truck maintenance basics and CNG safety standards.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Basic computer literacy (Excel, email, data entry, MS suites or packages).
	Ability to work in shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	Knowledge of HSE principles, fire safety, and incident reporting.


Compensation and Benefits
We offer a competitive compensation package, including:


	A competitive Salary
	Health Maintenance Organisation (HMO) Plan
	Annual Leave allowance
	Statutory Pension Contributions
	Opportunities for training and Growth.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hrjobs@gastechltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Project Management Executive Job at Globalclique Resources
content:
Globalclique HR - Our client, is a leading independent real estate firm of Estate Surveyors and Valuers, duly registered and regulated by the Estate Surveyors and Valuers Registration Board of Nigeria (ESVARBON) and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS), London. We are also a member of the Nigerian Institution of Estate Surveyors and Valuers (NIESV). With over 22 years of excellence and innovation in real estate services, and as a Collaboratory firm of Andersen Global, USA, we are committed to investing in our people—our greatest asset.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	To support our continued growth and expanding client base, we are seeking a proficient and experienced Project Management Executive to join our dynamic team at our Head Office in Lagos.
	We are seeking a Project Management Executive to join our Development Consultancy and Management team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the end-to-end process of real estate product development—from concept to market launch—while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful execution of strategic projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Define project scope, goals, deliverables, and success criteria.
	Develop comprehensive project plans, schedules, and budgets.
	Assign tasks, coordinate internal teams, and manage external vendors or partners.
	Provide regular updates on project progress, challenges, and milestones.
	Organize and lead project meetings, presentations, and reviews.
	Develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans.
	Oversee day-to-day project operations to ensure progress and quality.
	Monitor project budgets and control expenses to avoid overruns.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising quality.
	Ensure deliverables meet required standards and client expectations.
	Maintain comprehensive project documentation including reports, meeting minutes, and plans.
	Ensure compliance with organizational policies, industry standards, and legal regulations.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc / B.Eng. in Engineering, Estate Management, Quantity Surveying, Building or Architecture or a related field.
	Minimum of five (5) years of experience in a similar role, with proven experience managing medium to large-scale projects.
	Membership of relevant professional bodies (e.g., NSE, NIESV, NIQS).
	Certification in Project Management from a recognized institution (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2).
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Helioscope software, CAD, or other relevant engineering/project design tools.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to lead, influence, and manage cross-functional teams.
	Strong analytical skills and a data-driven, solution-oriented mindset.
	Excellent time management and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
	Highly organized, proactive, and adaptable personality.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits
	Official car
	13th-month salary
	Pension support
	NSITF contributions
	Healthcare allowance
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development
	Collaborative and innovation-driven work environment


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@globalclique.net using "Project Management Executive" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Accounts and Finance Manager Job at Globalclique Resources
content:
Globalclique HR - Our client, is a leading independent real estate firm of Estate Surveyors and Valuers, duly registered and regulated by the Estate Surveyors and Valuers Registration Board of Nigeria (ESVARBON) and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS), London. We are also a member of the Nigerian Institution of Estate Surveyors and Valuers (NIESV). With over 22 years of excellence and innovation in real estate services, and as a Collaboratory firm of Andersen Global, USA, we are committed to investing in our people—our greatest asset.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts and Finance Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	To support our continued growth and expanding client base, we are seeking a proficient and experienced Accounts and Finance Manager to join our dynamic team at our Head Office in Lagos.
	We are looking for a reliable Accounts and Finance Manager to lead the finance and accounts operations of the firm's real estate professional and business services.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for regular communication of financial status and risks of the firm's operations.
	Act as the financial advisor, responsible for the preparation of financial statements. High level of due diligence, competence for the generation of, and respect for all accounting standards, including FRCN are required for this position.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement financial strategies aligned with the company’s goals.
	Provide financial insights and recommendations to management for decision-making.
	Oversee day-to-day accounting activities including general ledger, accounts payable/receivable, payroll, and bank reconciliations.
	Maintain accurate and timely financial records in accordance with accounting standards.
	Ensure compliance with relevant tax laws, regulatory requirements, and financial policies.
	Monitor departmental spending to ensure adherence to budget limits.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Manage cash disbursements, bank relationships, and treasury functions.
	Supervise the preparation of cash flow projections and funding requirements.
	Ensure the team complies with internal control policies and procedures.
	Identify and mitigate financial risks through proper internal controls and insurance.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree in Accounting Finance, Economics, or a related field (mandatory).
	5 years of cognate experience (real estate company experience may be an advantage).
	ACA, (MBA, CITN, ACCA would be an asset).
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial regulations, and tax laws (e.g., IFRS, GAAP).
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, Tally, SAP, or Oracle ERP).
	Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and competency in other MS Office tools.
	Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to explain complex financial concepts to non-finance stakeholders.
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits
	13th-month salary
	Pension support
	NSITF contributions
	Healthcare allowance
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development
	Collaborative and innovation-driven work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@globalclique.net using "Accounts and Finance Manager" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
